required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Live Birth Rate Between the PPOS and the GnRH Antagonist Protocol in Patients Undergoing IVF
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Comparison of the Live Birth Rate Between the Progestin-primed Ovarian Stimulation Protocol and the Gonadotrophin Releasing Hormone Antagonist Protocol in Patients Undergoing in Vitro Fertilization

lead_sponsor.agency: ShangHai Ji Ai Genetics & IVF Institute

clinical_study.source: ShangHai Ji Ai Genetics & IVF Institute

brief_summary.textblock:
A randomized comparison of the live birth rate between the progestin-primed ovarian stimulation protocol and the gonadotrophin releasing hormone antagonist protocol in patients undergoing in vitro fertilization
Research question Does the live birth rate of the progestin-primed ovarian stimulation protocol comparable with the GnRH antagonist protocol for patients undergoing IVF?
Design This is a randomized controlled trial.
Research plan
Population: Infertile women who have medical indication for IVF will be recruited for study if they fulfil the selection criteria.
Intervention: Women will receive oral dydrogesterone 20mg daily from Day 3 till the day of ovulation trigger.
Comparator: Women will receive antagonist (Cetrorelix 0.25mg) once subcutaneously daily from day 6 of ovarian stimulation till the day of the ovulation trigger.
Outcomes: The primary outcome is the live birth rate the first FET.
Ovarian stimulation, egg retrieval, embryos frozen and frozen embryo transfer will be performed according to the standard operating procedures of the centres.

primary_outcome.measure: live birth rate of the first FET live birth rate of the first FET live birth rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: a live birth after 22 weeks gestation, through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: live birth rate of the first FET

secondary_outcome.time_frame: on the day of hCG trigger, an average of 2 weeks after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Serum estradiol level on the day of hCG trigger

secondary_outcome.time_frame: on the day of hCG trigger, an average of 2 weeks after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Serum progesterone level on the day of hCG trigger

secondary_outcome.time_frame: on the day of hCG trigger, an average of 2 weeks after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Serum LH level on the day of hCG trigger

secondary_outcome.time_frame: on the day of hCG trigger, an average of 2 days after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Serum FSH level on Day 2 of the period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the number of oocyte retrieved, an average of 2 weeks after randomization
the number of embryo, an average of 3 weeks after randomization
a blood hCG test is performed 14 days after the FET, up to 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: defined with the result of serum β-hCG ≥10 mIU/mL

secondary_outcome.time_frame: presence of intrauterine gestational sac on ultrasound at 6 weeks of pregnancy, up to 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: presence of intrauterine gestational sac on ultrasound at 6 weeks of pregnancy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: viable pregnancy beyond gestation 12 weeks, up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: presence of a fetal pole with pulsation at 12 weeks of gestation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: number of gestational sacs per embryo transferred at 6 weeks of pregnancy, up to 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: number of gestational sacs per embryo transferred

secondary_outcome.time_frame: multiple pregnancy beyond gestation 12 weeks up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: more than one intrauterine sacs on scanning

secondary_outcome.time_frame: a clinically recognized pregnancy loss before the 22 weeks of pregnancy, up to 22 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: defined as a clinically recognized pregnancy loss before the 22 weeks of pregnancy. The denominator is the clinical pregnancy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: ectopic pregnancy during first trimester, up to 12 weeks
a live birth after 22 weeks gestation, through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: birth weight of the baby delivered

secondary_outcome.measure: rate of participants with adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: adverse events during COH in an average of 1 month
obstetric complications during pregnancy or delivery in an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: obstetric complications during pregnancy or delivery. The information will be acquired by contacting all the participants through phone

secondary_outcome.measure: rate of fetal or congenital defects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: fetal or congenital defects found during pregnancy or delivery in an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: fetal or congenital defects found during pregnancy or delivery. The information will be acquired by contacting all the participants through phone

arm_group.description: Ovarian stimulation will use the progestin-primed ovarian stimulation (PPOS) protocol.Women will receive progesterone (oral duphaston 20mg) daily from Day 3 till the day of ovulation trigger.

Ovarian stimulation will use the antagonist protocol. Women will receive antagonist (Cetrorelix 0.25mg) once subcutaneously daily from day 6 of ovarian stimulation till the day of the ovulation trigger.

intervention.description: Women will receive oral duphaston 20mg daily from Day 3 till the day of ovulation trigger.
Women will receive antagonist (Cetrorelix 0.25mg) once subcutaneously daily from day 6 of ovarian stimulation till the day of the ovulation trigger.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age of women <43 years at the time of ovarian stimulation for IVF
- Antral follicle count (AFC) on day 2-5 of the period≥5
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of a functional ovarian cyst with E2>100 pg/mL
- Recipient of oocyte donation
- Undergoing preimplantation genetic testing
- Presence of hydrosalpinx which is not surgically treated or endometrial polyp on scanning during ovarian stimulation

New application of dydrogesterone as a part of a progestin-primed ovarian stimulation protocol for IVF: a randomized controlled trial including 516 first IVF/ICSI cycles. Hum Reprod. 2018 Feb 1;33(2):229-237. doi: 10.1093/humrep/dex367.

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results after deidentification (text, tables, figures, and appendices) and study protocol will be shared. Data will be available when beginning 3 months and ending 5 years following article publication. To achieve aims in the approved proposal, researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal will be shared with.Data will be made available by the following way. Proposals should be directed to lihe198900@163.com. And data are available for 5 years at a third party website (link to be included after the article publication).
